Reviews.Title: “careless treatment of a wedding party”
Reviews.Author: Laura-Jayne P
Reviews.Content: as we arrived at the hotel we were very impressed as we were in london for a friends wedding, when we arrived at reception we were dismayed to realise we werent all on the same floor as requested but instead were scattered around the hotel. then we went to our rooms which were tiny. we would not mind this butwe had booked in advance and on the internet the rooms looked very large hence why my friend booked them for her bridal party, the bride then had to complain to get her room changed as there was no way she could get ready in that room, they then moved her into a larger room more appropriate for a bride. No one seemed to be aware that this was a bridal party but the bride maintains she made them aware of this throughout. my problem with this hotel is that the advertising is very misleading. nowhere when you are booking does it say or show small room. luckily this did not affect was a lovely weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Poor experience”
Reviews.Author: wandererlux
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel at 10 pm after a long day's travel from Norway and had to wait 20 minutes to enter the room as the lock was broken. They must have known about it all day. The room was so small you couldn't open the wardrobe and the bathroom was miniscule. There was laminated flooring very unpleasant. The breakfast was appalling. All in all very disappointing. We stayed in this hotel several years ago and had a really good experience but the rooms have been changed since then and not for the better.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the rooms are small.”
Reviews.Author: Tamrafey
Reviews.Content: This hotel has many things going for it. The location is close to tube stops, Hyde Park is close, the wifi is free, the breakfadt buffet is lavish. But it really is true that there is no room for the luggage in the room. With two people, the double room was just too small.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest hotel but good value for London”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times now and as long as you know what to expect it is fine and for London it's very good value. The rooms are small but recently refurbished and clean, with tea / coffee etc. Similar standard to a Travel Inn. The hotel doesn't have many facilities but there is a good pub across the road and plenty of places to eat if you don't want to go far. The Lancaster Gate area is very quiet / residential - which is a good thing (West End hotels are usually very noisy most of the day/night). I've stayed in far worse hotels in London that cost 3 times the price. It's located a stones throw from Hyde Park and a short walk to the tube (Bayswater, Queensway or Lancaster gate) - which will have you in the West End in minutes. If you simply want somewhere to sleep then this hotel is fine. If you want hot and cold running room service and all the trappings of a big hotel - this is not for you - but you will also pay a lot lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Simply dreadful”
Reviews.Author: LHPW
Reviews.Content: This was easily the worst 4* hotel I have ever stayed in anywhere in the world, in fact to class it as 4* is an insult to the genuine 4* hotels in London. The room was tiny, the smallest I've ever witnessed in a hotel and the room was situated immediately above an overground train line which ran until well after midnight, and then from 6am on ensuring very little sleep anyway. Anybody of a large build would have struggled to turn around in the bathroom! The breakfast was appaling - plastic scrambled egg, very cheap sausages and beans was the full extent of the "English" breakfast and tea / coffee is self service from a vending machine. The only plus points were pleasent staff and a location only 5 or 6 stops to central London via the underground. There is absolutely no way this hotel can be classed as 4* - it is a very poor advert for both London and the UK at this star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Winner of smallest room”
Reviews.Author: SunPilgrim
Reviews.Content: London hotel rooms are very small but our room could win a prize for the smallest. We could hardly walk around the bed and there was no room for a chair. The bathroom was average sized but with poor lighting. There were two windows in our room which were good for openess but bad for noise. The complimentary breakfast was a large and fairly good buffet. The location was pretty good- close to Hyde Park & Paddington train station but off the main noisy street. There were restaurants (a couple Greek and a pub) nearby. The pub's carvery dinner was the best but watch out for hidden service charges at the others. Desk service was sort of backed up and slow.

Reviews.Title: “NOT 4 STAR”
Reviews.Author: su18g
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the henry V111 Hotel thinking it was 4 star, I stay in hotels alot and this hotel is not up to 4 star standard! The reception area looks tired but the welcome from the receptionist was very curteous and polite. he directed us to our room that we were going to be staying in for 5 nights. It was sold as a double room, I think the tongue was firmly n cheek here! There was just enough room for the double bed and fitted wardrobe we would have to have got changed in the bathroom. We asked for another room which was no problem for the gentleman on the desk. the next room was a little bigger. this hotel is very clean with lovely staff in good location BUT rooms are tiny, tv picture was green on old tv they don't even sell them like that anymore, the bathroom door kept getting stuck and locking us in, the breakfast is terrible, the pillows are made of concrete, THE SERVICE STAFF USE THE LIFTS DURING BREAKFAST TIME TO TRANSPORT DIRTY LAUNDRY SO YOU END UP TAKING THE STAIRS, the swimming pool could do with a good clean though the surroundings are fresh and clean. who gave them the 4 star rati ng?

Reviews.Title: “it is good hotel in good location but very standard”
Reviews.Author: Aisha A
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room , it was very small as i expect but with A/C + fan + heating + cofee and tea free of charge + free enternet in room + in good location close to bus station + 3 minute walking to hydepark + 5 minute by bus to oxford street , very nice location . the room looks clean but i found one bug in the room and another one in the toilit .

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Maverick300
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for a pre Christmas trip to London. Great location in a nice area and quite close to 2 underground stations. The hotel itself was ok, our room was clean and comfortable, although quite small. Breakfast wasn't brilliant, but adequate enough. There is a bar but it only opens in the evening I believe. The hotel has a lovely swimming pool, but the changing facilities are very basic (there are two curtained booths akin to clothes shop changing rooms right next to the pool!) We stayed here for 2 nights and found the room rate very competetive for London which is a big plus for the hotel. Would I stay here again?- Possibly.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: huda71
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 4 nights. It was the worst hotel i had ever seen. room were small, old furnished, the floor was woody with noise when i walk as if it is a boat, and the breakfast was bad too ! toilet did not work well also the air condition, and there was a bad smell of humidity all over the hotel ! I cant believe it is a 4 stars hotel... I dont like to go to this hotel again. and i dont advice people to go there too !

Reviews.Title: “Small room, toilet not working, key system very bad”
Reviews.Author: fagerheim
Reviews.Content: This is way to much money , so small room and bad breakfast

Reviews.Title: “never stay again”
Reviews.Author: 6078si
Reviews.Content: this hotel was classed as 4 star. It was not. The bar was only open from 7pm till 11pm. room was clean but extremely basic.It was also next to the air conditioning fans for the hotel.This kept me awake most of the night. The staff were very nice and apologetic when i complained .They said they are embarrassed by it being called a four star hotel. on a positive note the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Jake978
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying here after reading the bad reviews, but would urge you to not pay attention to them. The room was a good size, relitavely large for London, it was also clean & well decorated. The location is excellent - the street is quiet and only a short walk from the tube and restaurants/shops. The breakfast is excellent with plently of hot food, toast & pasteries. There are a few fussy eaters in our family but there was something for everyone, we didn't even have to buy lunch we were so full! The Staff were excellent, and contrary to some reviews spoke perfect english and the facilites were fantastic. Will definitely stay here again & have been recommending it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: LizHarrison
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 3 nights with my son in a twin room and will stay here again the next time im in London. Excellnt location we walked to Hyde Park and 5mins walk to bayswater tube station which we used everyday for sight seeing. plenty of restaurants and shops near by. The rooms are small but fine for a short trip and very clean, could do with a bigger TV with a few more channels (just channels 1-5) Staff are very nice and helpful, and the bonus of this hotel is deff the swimming pool/sauna (open 7-11) after a long day off walking round london!! we got breakfast included in our package deal which was good enough but if i was paying for it id prob eat out. would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, cheerful and well located”
Reviews.Author: 2elephants
Reviews.Content: Got the tube to Bayswater and rambled along a high street with supermarkets, and plenty of restaurantsand turned in to a nice residential area. Felt very safe and affluent area. The reception was good and effiecient. The room was small but perfectly formed with everything and bit more than expected (Trouser press? Really? This is London....). The room was spotless. Breakfast was included in my deal; the price was £8 which was OK I suppose for a self service buffet with 3 warm options (Bacon, scrambled eggs and baked beans), plus bread in 8 varieties, pastries, yogurts, cheese etc fruit, teas and coffee in different varieties etc. I'd probably eat out if it wasn't in my deal. While a larger TV in the room would have been nice, both of the lifts were small, and necessary to reach the top which was the 5th floor. .... that was all I can really complain about. It would make a very good and cheap base for getting about London and considering it has a swimming pool it would be nice for someone on a sightseeing holiday; just remember an umbrella!

Reviews.Title: “Tinest hotel room I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Tania N
Reviews.Content: We made the mistake of leaving our luggage in their room behind reception and then heading out for the evening before actually viewing our room. When we arrived back at the hotel it was nearly midnight. Our room was supposed to be a twin but only had one bed. I asked to change the room but was told they were fully bkd but could change on the 2nd night. My daughter sat on the bed and could touch both walls with her arms outstretched (have photo). The shower doors wouldn't meet and water went all over the floor. The water wouldn't drain away in the shower until I managed to fish out the biggest lump of hair and slime from the plughole(again, have photo!). The bed was definately not a full sized double. When we swopped the next day to a twin, we realised that the room they had given us the night before was usually used as a single. Only single wardrobe, coffee sachets for one person, no spare pillow, one plastic cup in bathroom etc. Twin room wasn't much bigger but at least we had 2 beds! There was nowhere to put your case, we spent most of the time trying to get out of each others way as we moved around the room! Breakfast buffet was okay as far as cereals, cold meat, fruit and bread go. The cooked part was pretty awfull- rubbery scrambled eggs and tepid baked beans were on a warmer in the corner. The hotel was very clean though and the staff were very friendly and their spoken english was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, Tiny, Tiny rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: hevchef
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for two nights and after travelling down from Nottingham on a friday evening we were looking forward to a shower and i nice meal out, however we never got our shower(in this hotel) as after we checked in to room 3 we took our bags and headed off. When we opended the door to our room it became quite apparent that we would not be staying in it! The room was tiny, you could not walk around the bed, we are by no means on the large size but we could not pass each other at the bottom of the bed either, so we took our luggage back to reception and asked the very nice and polite receptionist for another room, explaing why so she said that they had a twin room that we could have. so off we went to view the room and it was the same size as the first one so i went back and canceled our booking!! we finally got a gret hotel in canary warf for half the price and breakfst included.....and that room also had room for a sofa!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Tim D
Reviews.Content: That's about the main thing going for this hotel, situated close to several tube stations and really handy to Paddington for the Heathrow Express. That said, this hotel is pretty ordinary. Staff are friendly enough, rooms are clean & food is okay however the "elephant in the room" is the size of those rooms; they're tiny. Actually an elephant wouldnt fit in the room. I honestly think my room was a refurbished storage cupboard. On the plus side, it's located in a nice quiet street with restaurants, pubs, supermarkets, launderettes, etc nearby. I do have to admit that the location makes this hotel an obvious choice & I'd consider staying their again for that reason alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Upalong
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel close to Paddington station. This property was well reviewed by other TripAdvisor members. A bit pricey, but with a fabulous hot breakfast included, a very reasonable package overall. Rooms were adequate size, well equipped and air conditioned. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good for its price!”
Reviews.Author: ArmLeb
Reviews.Content: The good: Cleanliness; polite staff; nice buffet breakfast; comfortable bed (but quite small); decent bathroom; quiet street; adequate in-room amenities like tea/coffee kettle, safe, iron w/board, wall clock, hair dryer, A/C, ceiling fan; 5 min walk to bus station; 10/15 min walk to three tube stations and Paddington train station; close to Hyde Park; reasonable price. The bad: Very small rooms; thin walls; creaky floors; close to a rail track (a train passes every 5 min); small tv with only 7 channels; worn-out telephone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydneyKenny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in August 2011. From the time we arrived, the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room was not huge as others have said but what do you want.......pony rides in your room or a bed to sleep in after a day out seeing this great city. The room had a t.v, airconditioning, a nice deep bath, toilet and wash basin so what more do you need. Breakfast was very good and the free internet in the main lobby was very handy with keeping in touch with family and printing out boarding passes for our trip home. The heated pool and sauna was also a good way to relax after a busy day out. Transport was close, the park was down the road and we felt safe in the area. If people are not enjoying this hotel maybe it is them and not the hotel. I will be coming back to London and i will be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small but clean rooms, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Anastasios T
Reviews.Content: Henry VIII hotel is a very good solution, if you're looking for a relatively low-budget but decent accomodation in always exciting London. The hotel is very good located, just off Bayswater road, very close to Hyde Park and underground (Queensway, Bayswater) and bus stations. Especially, line 94 bus is very convenient for Marble Arch, Oxford Circus and Picadilly Circus, i.e. for almost the best attractions in London. The neighbourhood (Queensway) offers almost everything (restaurants, shops, money exchange, cafes, super markets etc.). Lively Notting Hill (Portobello road) is within walking distance. The rooms were very very small, but also very clean and relatively well equiped. Breakfast was not quite satisfactory, in terms of variety and quality, not for a 4-star hotel, anyway. The staff was very polite and helpful, though not always very fluent in English. In general, I keep good memories from my stay in Henry VIII hotel and I wouldn't mind stay there again, for a moderate price, of course.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel - Affordable prices”
Reviews.Author: 00kiksu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in July 2011. Hotel was clean and the staff was nice and helpful - though some of them didn't speak English that well. (Hotel was full of Spanish tourists) Overall the the experience was OK - The hotel was an walking distance from the nearest Underground Station (Queensway), Rooms were clean but a bit old. Breakfast was the basic one with eggs, sausages, bacon and bread + stuffings.

Reviews.Title: “This was the only >£300 option in London and it still sucked”
Reviews.Author: Noah C
Reviews.Content: A last minute business trip and booked through booking.com for the highway-robbery rate of £259/night. The first room they gave me, a single, was marginally larger than the single bed. I wasn't sure where to put the suitcase, so I asked for something else. They moved me to the room next door, a double (an "upgrade") which was certainly an improvement but overall I found the experience somewhat lacking. Their phone system was down, and half the reason I needed to stay here was to do a 3-hour phone conference from 10pm - 1am. Instead I did it on my cell phone at the cost of almost $200. I'm not sure in what world this hotel is a 4* but I would rate it not much more than 1*. Every time the people upstairs use their toilet, it makes noise in the room. The screen on my 13" Macbook Pro is larger than the television. The windows are terribly thin: I just heard the couple walking by whispering to eachother. I would highly recommend against staying here if you have any other option. About the only good thing I can add is that their Internet is indeed free.

Reviews.Title: “A SWIFT HOTEL MANAGERS REPSONSE”
Reviews.Author: typhoon999
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here last weekend. The Hotel is in a good location for Central London the Tube is a 5 minute walk away with Hyde Park adjacent. Having read previous Trip Advisor reports l was apprehensive on what we might find. On arrival the hotel exterior and been completely refurbished, inside it's slightly dated but clean and comfortable. We stayed in room 5, It is a very small room but was cleaned to a high standard, the ensuite is very small, if l am being very critical there was was one broken tile by the toilet and the bath had lost enamel in one small area, but again it was cleaned to a high standard. The air conditioning wasn't working, the room was too warm.The queen sized bed was firm and comfortable which was fine by me, we slept well. You can hear the sound of the London underground as the train pass closeby, l know this issue was raised by previous guests and also the size of the small televisions in the room, but l dont go away to sit in a room all day and night to watch TV and listen to the underground. Breakfast was my sticking point, this is where the hotel failed it wasn't a full English, there were only mushrooms, bacon and powdered scrabbled eggs, If you enjoy continental breakfast then its fine, although some of the products used weren't of the best quality, in particular the cereals. The cereal dispensing area was very untidy. Tea and coffee is self service from a vending type machine, pots of tea and coffee served to the table would be a far better idea. We had to wait a few minutes for a table to be prepared as the breakfast room was busy at 0900. To give credit, l submitted the satisfaction survey to the hotel on departure, highlighting these points and the manager responded withing 24 hours by e-mail This was part of his reponse to the breakfast and the air conditioning. Regarding your comments about the breakfast I would like to point out that the breakfast that all bookings include (as advertised also in the website Booking.com) is a buffet breakfast (not an English breakfast) that is the reason why there is only few hot products in the selection offer. Nevertheless we offer our guests the possibility to have a full English breakfast at an additional cost of £3. The air conditioning units have been recently installed and unfortunately they are not running 100% yet as there are some faults in the system that we are trying to fix at the moment. My apologies about this. It was a very quick repsonse from him and he has offered a 20% discount on my mastercard bill.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: sues81
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about staying in this hotel after reading some of the reviews but I was relieved when I arrived. I was early but my room was ready and I think I got upgraded as my room was huge (rm 16), very well equipt (although there was no iron in the room but they do offer a laundry service at an extra cost), clean room and comfy bed. Very good shower and plenty hot water! The swimming pool was a good size and only 2 others using it when I got there. Didn't use the sauna but it looked like it may have been coin operated, not sure how much it would cost. Breakfast was plentyful with lots of variety and choice. The "hot" food was a bit on the cold side but still edible - there was bacon, mushrooms and scrambled eggs (which are not as bad as some of the reviews make out!). Some of the carpets are worn in areas but they are not eye sores and don't cause a trip hazard so unless you stay in a hotel to look at the carpets, this shouldn't be a problem! My experience of this hotel was excellent, the staff were pleasant and helpful, the hotel was clean and it's a great location - ony 5 minutes or so from the nearest tube station. I would definately stay again and I would recommend this to others staying in London. I think some of the reviews on this hotel are a little unfair but perhaps this is due to higher expectations for a 4 star hotel? I enjoyed my stay though, please take some of the bad reviews with a pinch of salt!

Reviews.Title: “" 2 Star Hotel in need of attention"”
Reviews.Author: debefc77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in May. Great location close to Hyde Park and Queensway Tube Station. The Exterior of the hotel has recently had a lick of paint so looks very grand. The inside is currently undergoing some much needed upgrading. Carpets and furnishings were tired and old but new sofas were being delivered to reception whilst we were there. Carpets on stairwells were threadbare so hopefully this will be addressed. Staff were friendly and helpful to a point, most had trouble understanding more than basic English. The pool is pleasant to look at and clean but we never had time to use it. There isn't much point to having a pool in a central London hotel as there is so much to do in the city! The pool is why I am guessing the hotel has been rated as a 4 Star. Apart from this everything else is 2 star. The rooms are small, very basic but clean. Walls are paper thin and you can hear everything (and I mean everything) from the next room! Floorboards are old and creaky. Breakfast room is dated but with a flat screen TV in. The breakfast itself is fine if you stick to the continental but the hot food was gross, solidified egg, cold beans and something that resembled a sausage - not good! On the whole, it is a hotel that is really trying it's best but does need a lot of money and effort spent on it to be able to compete with other hotels in the area. Ok for a stay of one or two nights but no more. Location however is it's best plus.

Reviews.Title: “Very very small room”
Reviews.Author: Shaerohassas
Reviews.Content: I paid 600 euro for it :( the room very small u can't even open your cabin and put your clothes ...

Reviews.Title: “Good price in a nice place”
Reviews.Author: BetaMarro
Reviews.Content: I was there with my sister and it's a good hotel in an excellent ubication!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but....”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaMJ
Reviews.Content: Lots of scaffolding which other reviews indicate has since gone. Had to keep curtains closed as workmen clomping back and forth in front of them early morning. Hotel was OK overall, round the corner from Bayswater tube station which we found really handy. However, the "free" wireless didn't work and the provider (who I was told was not the hotel) then charged my credit card and I was only refunded after complaining to the provider (who was in the Seychelles....!). All the signs in the hotel are in Spanish & English and I agree with the other reviewer, all the staff seem to have English as a second language. Had trouble making myself understood, and I am English myself. The Buffet Breakfasts were great value with food being expensive in London and there was plenty of variety so you were bound to find something you would like. Again, a good value hotel if you're on a budget but don't expect a tour desk or the kind of concierge who can help get you organised. They tend to smile but clearly can't understand what you are saying. Find the cheap internet cafes on nearby Bayswater Road and book all your tours yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Powdered Eggs and Language Barriers”
Reviews.Author: LETSGOGB
Reviews.Content: We got just what we paid for.A good safe location pretty close to Paddington.Very small but, overall clean rooms. The on suite is tiny!You could brush your teeth in the sink while sitting on the loo and soaking your feet in the tub! But,it was a clean tub, toilet,sink with granite counter and floor.The breakfast looks good but, don't bother with the sausages, they aren't what they appear. They appear to be meaty, browned ,lovely tastey things but, are really week old cornflakes smashed up and put in a casing and maybe some kind of spray on sausage tan?!You've been warned... The fun was guessing powdered eggs or real. After several days of yuk(powdered eggs) my husband told me that we got real eggs. I told him no, he was just confused after so long,it couldn't be.Well he was right! So, then it was are they real today? Okay so, the food at least looks pretty and the place is pretty even with the carpet needing a little help here and there(which is being replaced, we saw new rolls coming in) it's about price and location which this has both!We got plenty of belly fodder and slept comfortably and went out to tourist it up, it was great!Oh, and most employees speak english as a second language. I spoke with a gal at the desk about the plug not working in the bathroom and a problem with my converter, she completely didn't understand me and nothing was done. I bought yet another converter only to see another employee hand out a converter from a basket that I had been inches away from when I was speaking to the first employee. She could have reached down 2 inches and handed me a converter out of a large basket of converters under the desk.Oh well. We weren't anywhere near the trains but, there are rooms at the far end of the hotel that are. The doors slam loudly can't be helped.Could hear the guy next door flicking his lite on and off over the bed. I would have known if anything more than that had happened... The TV worked fine BBC1,BBC2 etc.Would I use this hotel again? Definitely. One doesn't go to London for the food anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a quiet location that's got easy access to Wembley”
Reviews.Author: su3
Reviews.Content: As a woman travelling with my teenage daughter , I wanted a hotel that was clean reasonably priced and with easy access to the sights (& Wembley). This hotel was a gem of a find !!!!!!! Admittedly the rooms are on the small side but the beds were clean & comfortable. The receptionist gave a warm welcome & changed us to a twin bedded room with a smile (don't get many of those in London hotels). There is a small pool (nicely heated) & a small sauna which we took full advantage of. The best surprise was the following morning at the selection of foodstuff available for breakfast ( although the full English wasn't completely there, but there was bacon, hash browns & scrambled eggs). The price we paid was less than quoted by Travelodge & we had the bonus of a pool & breakfast. This is a hotel I felt safe in and the walk back to the hotel from Paddington late at night was through quiet roads and didn't encounter any noisy pubs, drunks etc.... I would recommend this to any women travelling alone or if your doing a girley shopping weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Character hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: traveller2010103
Reviews.Content: This was much better than I thought it was going to be due to some previous reviews. The scaffold has now gone so the outside looks great. We travelled with out 4 year old daughter. Comfortable room with three single beds (not ideal but not a big deal). Went in the swimming pool before breakfast which was nice and the breakfast itself was great with lots of choice. Two negatives - we couldnt find BBc1, 2 Channel 4 or 5 which was a shame as we were back in our room earlyish with our daughter. Other thing was the hair dryer kept cutting out. Would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “just awful”
Reviews.Author: smiller111
Reviews.Content: the title says it all realy, the rooms were shaby, the food at breakfast was terrible, they were rated as 4 star when i stayed there with my family, what a joke,i would not give them 1 star

Reviews.Title: “Shocking - never again!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSaddler
Reviews.Content: What a shocker - I would never stay at this hotel again. I first checked in and was given a room on the 2nd floor directly opposite the lifts, the room had a thread-bare carpet, scuffed and dented walls, stained walls and chair and was generally in need of a refurb. I immediately returned to reception to refuse the room I had been offered and was given a very shrift response of "I am sorry Sir but all of our rooms are the same". To which I replied, "I'm sorry but for £100 per night I at least expect carpet". After some discussion, I was shown 4 other rooms which disastrously ranged from red wine stained carpeted rooms to those on the ground floor which sounded like they were directly above the tube/subway tracks! I finally accepted a room on the 4th floor which I was told had been 'newly carpeted'. Breakfast was very basic and the small offering of hot food was luke warm at best. I will never stay here again and would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Powdered eggs and black mould!”
Reviews.Author: Lowie79
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip as a birthday treat - normally we would stay with friends in London. We were sadly disappointed. Upon arrival the hotel was covered in scaffolding, and it was only by going in to enquire where the hotel was that we discovered that, in fact, it was the hotel. The carpet was shockingly threadbare at the reception desk, which did not fill us with confidence. Our room smelt appallingly of stale cigarette smoke, and was very small - not at all like the rooms in the pictures. I complained, but was told that all rooms are non-smoking, and so there couldn't be any smell. The room was also scruffy, more like a hostel than a four-star hotel. The carpet was so filthy that we initially thought we had black mould - in fact, we only had black mould on the window. Rubbish had piled up outside said window and was actually leaning on the glass, so we had to keep the curtains closed. The headboard was broken, as was the mirror in the bathroom. What really annoyed my partner, though, was the lack of biscuits with the tea making facilities. Breakfast was truly, inspiringly awful. The eggs were powdered, the mushrooms tinned, the sausages of unidentifiable origin. On the other hand, the fresh fruit was nice. This was a relief, after the appalling experience of drinking the acid-like fruit juice. This, after smelling cigarette smoke all night and listening to people in the next room and in the corridor outside, was simply too much, and I complained. I was told that I couldn't complain, because there was no manager there that day, but the "trainee" (I kid you not) who was left on his own from when we checked in at 5pm to when we left at 10am, would pass my comments on. I would, even under duress, never go back to this hotel, or recommend it to anybody I thought of as a friend. Do not go to this hotel, it's horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: rfl10
Reviews.Content: Bypass the scaffolding when you first arrive as at least they are trying to improve the exterior. as for the inside what a let down! creaky floors, small rooms, threadbare carpets, thin walls. Rooms were nothing like the photos shown on their website! Self service buffet breakfast was appalling, tea and coffee from a machine, luke warm yoghurts because they were not chilled, cheap fruit juice, stale cereals with no taste and the toaster either burnt or did not toast the bread at all. Not many smiley faces at breakfast, probably due to the lack of sleep and crap food! Have never felt the need to complain about any hotel before and we have stayed in quite a few ranging from 5 star to 3 star this is definately not a 4 star hotel, more like a 2 star.!

Reviews.Title: “Don´t go!!! One of the crappiest hotels, I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: BelleBamboozle
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny! There was no space for our suitcase and whenever I tried to open the bathroom door, I fell over the suitcase, because it was blocking the door. Yes, that´s how small the room was. One word: terrible! Please don´t go. We switched hotels after two nights and stayed at the nearby Park Inn, which was better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “NOT for a romantic weekend.... or at all!!”
Reviews.Author: BFitz1989
Reviews.Content: To celebrate our anniversary my boyfriend and I chose this hotel as part of a hotel/theatre deal after researching lots of other hotel choices, as it looked very nice in photos and the location was perfect for us. But upon arriving the outside of the hotel was covered in scaffolding and the entrance had big wooden boards along the walkway. as we entered the reception the carpet looked like it had lost a fight with an angry tiger, and the sofas looked like they could have been pulled from a skip. The hotel's only saving grace were 2 of the reception staff who were fairly helpful. We got into the lift (which was claustrophobic to say the least) which took us to our floor. as we stepped out onto the hall the creaking on the floor was terrible, but assumed once we were in the room we would not hear it. We were very wrong, and as our room was right next to the lift we could hear that, plus the loud noise of trains going past every 10 minutes. The room itself was very dated, but clean. However, and without any exaggeration, the space around the small double bed could have been no more than half a metre each side. It can only be described as a box room. In fact the bathroom was probably only marginally smaller than the main room, which, when there is only room for a shower, sink and toilet, is saying something! My boyfriend and I have stayed in a few less than perfect hotels, and usually laugh it off, but this was beyond any humour. So he went to complain to reception and ask edto be moved to a bigger room or one that wasn't next to the lift. He was told by a member of staff that all the rooms were exactly the same size and if we wanted to be moved we would have to wait until morning. With nothing else left to do about the situation we got some very interrupted sleep, hoping the next day would be better. As we walked to the lift for breakfast the next morning a different room door was opened for cleaning, and when we looked into it, it was very clearly much bigger than our room, which just angered us even more after realising the reception staff had outright lied about the sizes of the rooms. So as we sit for breakfast (after choosing the full english buffet option rather than only continental), we went to get food. I'm not sure where the hotel staff have had a "full english" before, but this is certainly not what was on offer. in fact the only "full english" items available were sausages, scrambled egg and mushrooms. The only juice available was tropical, and the quality of it all was very low. I have never ever felt the need to write a review about the bad state of a hotel before now. It is a clean hotel, and 2 of the many staff we met were friendly enough, but those were the only good things. We were moved to a slightly bigger room, but by then the damage had been done, and our romantic weekend had been dampened significantly. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone for any occasion. It was certainly not cheap, and regardless of the reason for your visit, I can guarantee you will get a terrible night's sleep thanks to the constant noises.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: mbent
Reviews.Content: The single rooms are not really bigger than your average closet, which is to expect from your standard 3-star hotel around Bayswater/Paddington, but the biggest problem is the ridiculously loud noise. Not only does the floor squeak in your own room, but also in the corridor and every other room, and since the walls are paper thin don't bother trying to sleep without earplugs. Also, they've managed to locate the hotel so that every train leaving Bayswater station literally shook my room (Every 5 minutes from 5.30am to midnight. My room was at the 4th floor, I hate to imagine staying at 1st floor), haven't experienced this before in the Bayswater area hotels. Breakfast is above standard, and the location is quite good with Paddington linking it to the Heathrow Express and Bayswater/Queensway stations very close. Then again, you'll find better options within the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away...you have been warned.”
Reviews.Author: Chelseafc4life
Reviews.Content: The only saving grace for this place is the location. Near the underground and the many local necessity shops, right near Hyde Park. Our room was tiny, even compared to British standards. It was tired and very dated. The T.V was tiny and not worth trying to view from the bed. In room safe not working, toilet needed 3 - 4 flushes for it to do it's job properly and breakfast was not flash at all. Oh and the bed, if you enjoy sleeping with a spring poking you all night then you will love the bed we had. Communication and service from staff was very hit and miss. Had to book a cab early in the morning and so requested staff to call cab and organize. All I can say is, thank god I double checked the booking because the cab was coming 4 hours to late and taking us in a different location than the one requested. The scaffolding at the front of the joint was very off putting as well. All in all, book only if other hotels in area are full.

Reviews.Title: “Noway is this a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: elephant009
Reviews.Content: Building covered in scaffolding when we arrived, this wouldn't have actually bothered me if we had been given some warning of this, when we walked through the doors we noticed the decor was what I would decribe as 'tired'.Our room did not in any way match the photos on thewebsite. The staff were not very welcoming, none of them smiled at us. When we went into the room is smelt and it was very very hot, the carpets were thread bare and stained and when my partner laid down on the bed he hurt his head on the head boeard as part of it had fallen off and not been replaced so there was a sharp edge sticking out. On a more posistive note the bathroom was clean but very basic and the bed linen was clean. We decided not to risk the full English breakfast at £10 per head. The hotel is near to the underground and it was very quiet at night ... probably because no one wants to stay there. In all honesty you would get better vaue for money in a travel lodge or other type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: jeff605
Reviews.Content: Room adequate, clean, beds comfortable. Noise from lift horrendous, had to request room change which was dealt with calmly and pleasantly. Staff experience excellent. Unfortunately breakfast not very good, hot food cold, sausages inedible.

Reviews.Title: “OK Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: robertjrossonwye
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night when visiting London for family wedding. Read the TripAdvisor reviews after booking and was not expecting much. It did exceed my expectations, Friendly, helpfull staff. Rooms are small as you would expect for a capital city hotel, it was clean and tidy, bathroom was pleasant, clean and smart enough. Some parts of the Hotel could do with a refurbishment, carpets on the stairs very worn, carpet in my room stained. Various screw holes in the walls of the room that had not been filled in and painted over.For the price that I paid, in London, I thought that it was good value and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Will never return - awful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AndreeaD77
Reviews.Content: First of all, we couldn't find the hotel ..we walked on the street for a long time, luggage and all, and then had to return and found a building site. Underneath the scaffolding it was written Hotel Henry VIII; what a joke! First impression - really really bad. And got worse.. The room was really small for a 4-star, and it was horrible - the attached pictures tell the story. Everything was old and torned out: the wallpaper was ripped, carpets stained, ancient TV, old windows. The water was oily, the feeling was that you can't get the soap out of your hands. I didn't find this horrible water in the entire London, in pubs/bars/restaurants etc. The bathroom had some wood plug on the ceiling, veeery "good" looking..I don't know why.. The toilet didn't function properly, it was a mess. The hotel didn't have plug adaptors, of course.. They had only one, and they gave it to us saying that it "might be broken" and they don't have another and this is all that they can do! Of course it was broken, and afterwards we couldn't even unplug it! So we had to buy 2 adaptors from a store nearby, at 9 p.m., and the price was of course very high: 5 pounds each! The staff was horrible, horrible attitude, not at all helpful, but arrogant and really stupid! I would fire them in an instant if they worked for me. The TV was again a joke - I have attached a picture. Very old, small and having about 5-6 channels, never heard of them, nothing interesting. No Discovery, NGC, Animal Planet or even BBC news! Nothing decent whatsoever! The ONLY good thing about this hotel is that it provides free wi fi. And we used it to watch movies on youtube, on our mobile phones! We didn't use the TV at all! Also, no refrigerator! How can they rate this 4 star?! The windows didn't close properly, so the room was pretty noisy. All in all, I would rate it 2 stars maximum, and would not recommend it to anyone! It was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out is not the word”
Reviews.Author: otomed
Reviews.Content: We looked forward to a London weekend to see a musical and enjoy the last night of the Proms. We had searched the internet and finally settled for Henry VII as our hotel during our visit. Not cheap, but a location opposite Hyde Park was not too bad. On arrival the entire front was covered in scaffolding. From what we could see , a renovation was more than due. The reception did not seem to be prepared for a new look allthough it would be much needed. Carpets not just worn, but with big holes and a more than filthy look. Receptionist was a young girl apparantly with spanish background and whose english skills could have been better . Room was a farce . Facing the street - and scaffolding. so you could hardly look out the window, but that was difficult anyway . The curtains were so dirty that probably no dry cleaner would take the job to clean them . Small bed , cheap furniture and a TV so small that I have never seen anything like it. Breakfastbuffet ? Very small selection, and empty trays which only seldom was filled up. However, coffee was good :-) If you can avoid this place- do it .

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet Bayswater hotel”
Reviews.Author: andand49
Reviews.Content: Henry VIII Hotel lies on a quiet street in Bayswater but still within walking distance from 4 Underground stations and there are plenty of pubs and restaurants nearby. The reception area is spacious but gives a worn impression. The staff is very friendly and helpful. As usual in London, the rooms are small, even very small, and give also a worn impression, especially the floor carpets. The TV was pure disaster - very small, old and with bad picture. The bathrooms, on the other hand, looked recently renovated and were very fresh, although small. The rooms were clean and I got new towels every day. The breakfast, which was free of charge, was very good with lots to choose from, even scrambled eggs and bacon. Unless watching TV is important to you, I really can recommend this hotel, especially if you can get a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star maximum”
Reviews.Author: PeterArthur
Reviews.Content: Had trouble locating the hotel on our arrival as it looked like a building site, Hotel facade was covered with scaffolding (We were not advised of this). Room was so small we could not both move around at the same time. It really was a single room with two beds. The hotel is Spanish owned, the staff are all Spanish and so is the breakfast. Coffee and tea from a machine and those awful cereals you get when on a Spanish holiday. The hotel boasts a bar, but unless you get to sit on one of the few barstools, you will have to take your drink up a flight of stairs as the only lounge area is in reception. Slept well, but only because there was a tube strike that day (the tube line runs behing the hotel. On the postivie side, everything was clean and the staff were friendly, but ther are much better hotels in london (By a Mile!)

Reviews.Title: “Grim Room”
Reviews.Author: anon186342
Reviews.Content: Don't bother, the swimming pool is okay, but the sauna doesn't work. Our room, 318, was small with a crap TV. Grim is how I would describe it. The cup of tea we had in the room, tasted really strange....could be the water. The staff were very friendly but no recompense for the grim room.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Henry VIII”
Reviews.Author: marcopolowow
Reviews.Content: Very nice service and a great location. Great value for your money. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “4 star Hotel their having a laugh aren't they?!!”
Reviews.Author: Squidders_10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the internet as a birthday surprise for my husband and what a surprise it was. The rooms were small, the wallpaper was ripped, carpets stained, shower leaked and television set was ancient and not tuned into digital so picture kept ghosting. The bed was not a double and only just bigger than a single so every time we turned over we thought we were going to fall out. In the morning we thought that they couldn't ruin the breakfast but how wrong we were. The coffee was out of a machine, the orange juice diluted and sugar puffs mixed in with the muesli. The sausages were burnt and the scrambled egg came up in one piece!! I wrote complaining to the Managing Director of this chain of hotels and as yet have not had the courtesy of a reply or apology. In hindsight we would have been better off at a Premier Inn at half the price. 4 star it just be marketed as 1 or 2 star!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff but what a waste of money”
Reviews.Author: EdelleMcCrudden
Reviews.Content: The room wasn't big enough to full open the door and I couldn't stand on either side of the bed without falling into the wall or bed. The bathroom was bigger than I could have imagined but that didn't make up for the shabby, tiny bedroom. Breakfast was woeful and really only catered to those who enjoy a continental. No tea served. Was so disappointed that even though I was only there for 2 nights that I dreaded the thought of going back to the room, even when exhausted. No air conditioning so had to open the window. There is a train running very close to the hotel so that woke us the next morning. Disappointed with what was on offer for 150 pounds a night. Look else where

Reviews.Title: “Do not book unless you like no sleep”
Reviews.Author: Celtic74
Reviews.Content: Hi I booked this hotel and must say for it to have a 4 star rating in the modern day is a surprise. Rooms the smallest I have been in. Air con did not work in any room apparently a hotel issue in middle of a london heat wave ! Rooms tired and breakfast very poor . scrambled eggs and bacon on offer. fruit juice not actually fruit juice but diluting ! Bread not fresh and fruit selection slices of orange with rind (like you get in a drink). I never ecpect much in London on the hotel front for room size but it is very easy to do a half decent breakfast .

Reviews.Title: “You can definitely do better.”
Reviews.Author: Tzipster
Reviews.Content: London has so many hotels, one would think that hotel mgt would try to make the paying customers happy so as to get repeats and recommendations. We booked and pre-paid 5 nights through getaroom.com many months in advance and were confirmed a room with a/c. Thanks fo Trip Advisor, we knew to request one of the bigger rooms away from the train station. We called a week earlier from Scotland to confirm and tell them we would be checking in late on Friday for our 5 night stay and to please make sure we would get the requested room. Long story short, tiny room, barely enough room for the furniture, and worst of all, no a/c! Temps in London were in the 80's and humid. Come on, had I known the a/c wasn't working, I would not have booked there. Every room had a unit and we were told they were working on it. Not true. We think the owner was saving on what would have been a huge electric bill in the heat. Stranagely, the a/c worked in the lobby and the breakfast room...When we complained a clerk at the registration said: THere is a phone there. YOu can call another hotel." How is that for unfriendly. After 3 days there we did speak to a mgr who was polite and apologetic buy said we should never have been promised a/c. Oh well, go elsewhere! But if in LOndon, dodd go see "War Horse". It is a very wonderful and unusual show at the National on Drury Lane.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but everything you need”
Reviews.Author: lovebug
Reviews.Content: We booked as a secret hotel so good price. Expected the worse after reading reviews but quite relieved on arrival. Staff very friendly and helpful. We were on ground floor and could hear the tube and "generator" noise from outside so sleep quality not so good. Bed linen and toiletries good. Actually were given a comb and shoe horn! TV reception was very poor but we only wanted to listen to the news. Breakfast choice was reasonable especially cold selection but hot selection could have been hotter. Location excellent for us as we were at the concert at Hyde Park so short walk back and handy for tube station next morning. They offered to store luggage but we took with us. If we stayed again we would request a high floor. Overall we thought good value for what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “I booked prior to Reading other reviews...”
Reviews.Author: iftravel
Reviews.Content: I booked prior to Reading other reviews and then started to actually read what others had said. I stay in many hotels for business and I have to say that this is a refreshing change. The single room is impressive for the price. It's clean, modern and more spacious than what I normally get given in the more well known names. The staff were most welcoming. Clearly this is not a well known branded hote but I personally think it pats to try something different from time to time although I'm sure I'll be back here. There is even a choice of ceiling fan or air conditioning (or both).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff, worn out, weary rooms, dusty Dickensian atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Delm0
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Lastminute.com's 'Secret Hotel'. It was described as 'recently refurbished' and situated in a fantastic Bayswater location. I don't think that parts of the hotel had been recently cleaned - avoid taking the stairwell without a dust mask. The carpet in the tiny room was literally threadbare and door surrounds had rotten wood from bathroom water, furniture was corporate flatpack circa 1986. The location is quiet and great for Hyde Park, however what the description doesn't tell you is that the tube runs directly under the hotel - so don't expect to sleep until after midnight. On the upside, the staff were friendly and welcoming and deserve to work in an establishment that has more than a decent swimming pool to offer. (Breakfast was OK too.) Oh, don't be tempted by the so-called savings of the Secret Hotel facility. If you just want somewhere to sleep, you're 5' 6" or under, hearing impaired and have no allergy to dust, then book direct with the hotel - it's cheaper!!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with lovely people”
Reviews.Author: anniePortTalbot
Reviews.Content: Was a bit spectical about the hotel after reading some of the reviews, but boy were they wrong. Yes the rooms are quite small, but aye who goes away to sit in their hotel room! the pool was a fab temperature, the sauna was fantastic and there is free internet in the rooms as well as desk top computers in reception with free access to the internet again. I come to London quite a lot and this was the cheapest hotel I have stayed in and well worth value for money. Yes, bits of the carpert are a bit worn but the hotel is cleaned to a very high standard. The only down side was you can faintly hear the rattle from the tube station when in bed. I will def be going back in August. Hyde park is a 5 min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: ljensenuk
Reviews.Content: I came to London with my 13 year old daughter to see a show and stayed one night at the Henry VIII Hotel. We chose the hotel because of it's leisure facilities as we wanted to relax and treat ourselves over the weekend, however the sauna did not work and the swimming pool area did not even have the facility to sit down anywhere! There are no changing rooms, just a curtained cubicle and no toilets unless you want to go down the hall! It was absolutely freezing and we were desperate for the sauna to warm up which never did, despite the receptionist giving us the tokens for us to operate it! The room was very small and the bathroom was extremely basic with the cheapest, naffest complimentary toiletries I've ever come across. There was no temperature control in the room, either in the form of air-conditioning (as it was roasing hot) or controls on the radiator, so that, combined with the small, uncomfortable bed, made it quite difficult sleeping. The other big disappointment was the breakfast which was just horrible. They had a very poor quality buffet breakfast and a couple of 'luke-warm' hot plates with awful scrambled eggs and rubbery, grey, tinned mushrooms! If you wanted anything else, you had to pay extra and at the price we paid and the 4 star recommendation, I thought it was a complete joke. We were just so disappointed as the experience of staying at a hotel should be a treat. I recently stayed at a hotel near Gatwick airport which was half the price of the Henry VIII hotel and you felt that they really cared and put extra effort into making your stay enjoyable, hence why it was an excellent experience. We have stayed in bed & breakfasts, guest houses and hotels all over the world and I'm sorry to say that this was one of the poorest experiences I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Always and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: TWINETOURS
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Henry VIII with our tour groups since 2002 and have never had a bad experience. As frequent travelers to London know, virtually all hotel rooms are small- and the Henry VIII is no exception. However, for a value-priced hotel, we have always found the premises very clean and the staff extremely polite and efficient. The hotel offers an excellent buffet breakfast every morning, included in the room price. The manager, Marc Sancho, is an extremely nice man who takes pride in offering complete customer satisfaction. We have always found him to be a pleasure to deal with. The hotel also offers a nice size indoor pool- quite a rarity for London. Our repeat tour customers always express a desire to stay at the Henry VIII and our most recent trip in April was our best ever. This is not a luxury hotel, mind you. The rooms are quite small, but this is the case throughout London unless you are prepared to spend premium prices. Also, the two elevators/lifts are very claustrophobic, but these are minor quibbles. The hotel is located in a great area, right off of Hyde Park in Bayswater. The nearby Queensway and Bayswater tube stops are just minutes away and this section offers a wealth of restaurants, stores and convenience shops. It's also an excellent idea to take walks through Hyde Park, which is right up the street. The Henry VIII also recently installed wireless internet service in all rooms- and it's free. In all, an excellent value. We'll keep returning!"

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: akla
Reviews.Content: After having read some of the reviews of Henry VIII at TA, I considered cancelling our booking, but never came round to do it. We've been in London several times before, and compared with our previous experiences, we were very satisfied with the hotel. The location is perfect, and breakfast was better than expected (I am satisfied as long as I get my yoghurt and muesli). The carpet in our room could do with a cleaning, but everything else was clean and tidy. The reception staff were nice and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book here!!!”
Reviews.Author: miloaussie
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel, or this chain of hotels to anyone. After travelling for 42 hours (with transfers) from Australia we were eager to get into our room for a quick rest. Instead it took us another hour before we could get some respite. We have stayed in London before & this time we wanted to stay on the northern side of Hyde Park because we were meeting friends on Portobello Road for Mother's Day the following day. The abrupt & unsympathetic desk staff told us that our room had "No hot water" therefore they would be transferring us to another hotel on the southern side of Hyde Park. PLEASE ...don't insult any traveller’s intelligence with this line!! Jet lagged or not, I knew the hotel was being deceitful because they had overbooked. When I asked the desk staff about this trick of moving guests to another hotel, they denied all knowledge. I had read several accounts on the internet about this type of concocted story online from other travellers & knew the Hotel had overbooked & were now moving guests to other hotels in their chain. Other excuses that had been made previously were: 'the plumbing is not working,' or 'the lighting is not working'. It was not too difficult to put two and two together and work out that 'the hot water is not working' was just another excuse!! Another 2 guests who arrived after me, were able to stay on the floor where 'the hot water was not working' (the staff did not know that I was listening) & were told there was no problem with the water...when I told them what had happened to me!! We therefore paid for a 3 star hotel upfront / over the internet & were transferred to a 2 star hotel (as displayed on the individual hotel's website). It then cost us an extra 15.00 pounds to get back across to Portobello Road the next day. In Australia we have the Trade Practices Act which would cover misleading or deceptive conduct such as the behaviour displayed by Henry VIII - instead I will tell all my friends & acquaintances: DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad as reported!”
Reviews.Author: MalawiNewbury
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel and then was horrified to read the reviews. However we found it perfectly adequate for what we wanted and certainly wasn't as described by others. Yes, the room was small but we didn't spend a lot of time there so it didn't matter. The staff on reception were extremely helpful, our room was clean and the hotel didn't smell. We enjoyed our two swims in the pool though the arrangement is slightly strange in that there are just a couple of curtained off changing cubicles - on our second visit we went already with our swimming costumes on. As for breakfast, it was the usual buffet you would expect but we enjoyed it.. The main thing we liked about the hotel was the easy walk up from Paddington Station and being so close to the Park - Its just at the end of the road - so had a very enjoyable walk up to Oxford Street on our second day. J Pearson

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: gulliversoy
Reviews.Content: this hotel is supposed be 4 stars but it is small, dirty, smelly, and worn down. stay away. there are no smoking signs everywhere but the hotel smells of smoke. the internet in the room is supposed to be free but does not work. there is no walking space in the room. the tx is tiny and from the 1970s. and there is no coffee in the room either.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCIE”
Reviews.Author: Meritxell_10
Reviews.Content: Panthom's Hotel. Never again I will come back to this hotel. They have a big trouble with room's key. I was sleeping calm, and suddenly other customers GET INTO MY ROOM at 1:30 a.m. in the morning. Just to have a hard attack. Personal service is the only that this hotel has acceptable. Rest facilities are very poor. Not for a four stars hotel. Rooms are like in Liliput (very very small). TV does not work. Atmosphere is old and it smells old. During night there are STRANGE NOISES that make it very difficult to sleep. As I said, I never again will go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “There is no way this hotel is a four star hotel Iwould not give two stars.”
Reviews.Author: mollyonedublin
Reviews.Content: If you or anyone you know are thinking of staying at this hotel PLEASE do not.It is rated a four star hotel there is no way anywhere in the world this place could be rated a four star and the person who rated it should be SACKED.The breakfast was a joke 3 not so hot plates the food was still cold.We would have been better going 100 yards down the road for breakfest for 5 pound.TO say the rooms were small is a understatement the first room we got was so small there was no room to walk between the bed and the wall.The only good thing about it was, I did not book this hotel my wife did so I will not have to hear about it for the next 20 years as it was a birthday present for me.I could go on and on but I will not because I will be all night and I have a life,so if you are thinking of booking this hotel PLEASE PLEASE do not make the same mistakes as we did do not book it .

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: jogijada
Reviews.Content: small rooms, not comfortable, cheap furniture, bad condition. Shower did not work well (stayed on the 5th floor, apparently not enough pressure in the water lines). Quite poor breakfast. Bag from one of the guests was stolen from the breakfast room !!! Personnel was not of great help in this occasion... And when I got home I found out my bottle of perfum was missing.

Reviews.Title: “Best avoided”
Reviews.Author: bebrady
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights here and I was very disappointed by this hotel overall. The only positives I can find is the location, close to Hyde Park and a couple of tube stations, and the reasonable price. The rooms were small and dirty, from the walls to the sheets. Having asked for the quilt cover to be changed due to stains, we came back to find a similarly stained pillow case was still on the bed. The rooms were noisy with sounds coming from nearby rooms and the bathroom, as there is not a proper door enclosing the bathroom. The breakfast had adequate choice but the hot food was never more than lukewarm. Service was inadequate - we booked a tour through the hotel staff only to find that they were unable to provide us with vouchers for the tour company, or details on where to join the tour. I would have posted this review while I was there but the advertised free wi-fi is not free - it is £5/hour!

Reviews.Title: “a health hazard!!”
Reviews.Author: DublinBilly68
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this hotel for 5 nights, however we didn't even stay for the 1st one! When we got to our tiny double room we found it to be very shabby. The carpets were stained and mouldy. My alarm bells immediately went off and I checked the mattress. I was horrified to find a filthy urine stained mattress that they didn't even bother to try and cover up with a mattress protector. I turned it over to find the other side in an even worse state. We were offered another room which also had a urine stained mattress even worse than the first one! When there was no offer of a new mattress we had to leave and find another hotel. They also told us that they would be charging us for the night. This hotel serves as a health hazard and should be avoided at all costs. It also has the nerve to rate itself as a four star..unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Need review”
Reviews.Author: TripperrrrUK
Reviews.Content: Hmmm, I have never written a review, but in the case of Henry VIII felt that I had too.... So needed a hotel at last minute for Business (Still here actually on non refundable booking through lastminute.com).....For 5 days from Sunday to Thursday was down as £1290 and I paid £380 (Which is not bad for 5 nights with breakfast and internet in Central London) I agree with other comments on here, I am in a single room and boy is it single !!! Have to move the bed to open the wardrobe and desk chair hits the bathroom door if you move it back.... I will list good and bad starting with bad to good as that wont take too long 1) Photo's on net looked great 2) £380 for 5 nights in London with Breakfast & Internet is not bad 3) Thought that was a great price for a 4 star 4) Really makes you look forward to going home..... 5) 1 out of the 2 lifts sometimes works 6) Only have to walk 2 steps to get from bed to bathroom So onto the bad..... 1) Claims to have been recently refurb'd - May well be true but all I can say is the chief designer must have been a blind dwarf (no offense to the vertically challenged), my room was tired, worn and in all fairness that of a 2 star at best 2) Internet (yes is free) dropped its connection on a fairly regular 4 minute basis, when I asked the reception about this, they suggested that I either move my laptop or try again later 3) Receptionist was about as charismatic as a teenager chewing a bumble bee 4) Breakfast (Full English as it was publicised) consisted of VERY COLD scrambled eggs VERY COLD sausages and VERY COLD rock hard beans - I grabbed a Pret on the way to Bayswater station instead 5) Unless there is a big pay off conspiracy, not in this world is the Henry VIII a 4 star and NO ONE should pay anymore than £40 - 50 per night at all - If I was Ruth Watson, I would give the hotel a fair 2* 6) No AC, not a great problem as the rooms are so small that if you are cold, shut the window and if you are hot open the window - simple.... If however you are looking simply for a bed in central London that is near both Circle and Central line tubes, I guess you could do worse, (not sure how but certain you could) Would I stay again ??? Probably not, I would try my luck again on last minute, you never know, I might get better, might get worse but willing to take that chance.... Please please please do not pay full whack for the Henry VIII it is just not worth it... Hope this helps...(Only 4 nights to go - Yeahhhhh !!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Old - but clean...”
Reviews.Author: Mix19
Reviews.Content: I will not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a 4 star hotel experience, which the hotel states that it is on their web-site. Rooms were very small, carpet and wallpaper were stained, moldy... tv was 14 inch and only two channels worked proberly. The bathroom was very small and almost everything was in poor condition....- but clean. Service was not something we came across. Staff wasn't rude or anything, just very indifferent. Breakfeast... Again, it was there, but nothing amazing. Beds were nice, although we ordered a doublebed we got twinbeds... And the list goes on. If you're looking for a good 4 star hotel (or 3 for that matter) don't stay at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeBlack
Reviews.Content: Clean and well located, but it is an old building in need of renovations. Small rooms compared to other higher class hotels. The breakfast was really poor. We won't stay there anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Practical in Bayswater”
Reviews.Author: OysteinS2
Reviews.Content: One of the white hotels close to Bayswater Road. 5 mins walk to Queensway and Bayswater sub-stations. OK standard. Small rooms as usual in these hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Destroyed honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: chris666
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back home from a stay at the Henry VIII hotel. WHAT A DISSAPOINTMENT!!!!!!!!!!!!! A four star hotell that should be ripped of it's stars. We contacted the reception when it turned out that our room didn't have any water. My husband were asked if he really needed a shower on our stay..... HELLO????? After a promise to fix the problem during the day, we returned to the hotell in the afternoon to be told that we lied and that our room had water. We went upstairs - and NO no water at all. After some discussing we were offered to shower in another room, but we would have to return the key as soon as we vere finished showering..... My husband went down to the reception to find out what their plan was to get water in our room - NO PLAN - but another offer to use the toilet facilities in the basement. With me pregnant needing to use the toilet during the night, this was not satisfactory!!!! We kept the key to the second room. When attempting to go into this room later that night to use the facilities the reception had closed the key. So, back againg to the reception where we were accompanied to our room by hosekeeping. The lady tried the shower and sink - no water. She told us there was nothing she could do and she left. We left the hotell to go to the toilett at a cafe near by. The next morning we checked out as soon as possible and left for the airport. We were not offered any excuse or money refund for the poooooor service. NOT RECOMENDED AT ALL - TAKE AWAY THE STARS!!!! Our honeymoon was destroyed by this hotell and their staff - which could not have been attending any hotell training at all!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints- but not 4*”
Reviews.Author: joplin
Reviews.Content: Booked through Lastminute.com to see a show. Package included 1 night stay + breakfast + full use of hotel. 2 people, twin rm.(317). 2:00 check -in but if rm available can get in earlier. There is a luggage rm in the mean time if you need to leave it and come back. The hotel is in Bayswater area. Hyde Park is virtually across the road for a nice walk in the park. On arrival we were very well welcomed- room was changed from a double to twin -no problem -given all information needed for hotel -very pleasant + efficient receptionist . Rm was little small but suited our needs for overnight - very clean -carpet on floor was worn and stained- (but clean) looked like from teabags or spilling/ missing the bin - bathroom very nice, very clean, lovely hot shower good temperature control + toiletries provided. Kettle and good supply of tea/coffee to make in room. The beds were very comfortable and nice and clean. We made use of the swimming pool very acceptable- good supply of towels and changing facilities - no one else was in it so we had it to ourselves then went back to room to rest and get ready to go out to evening show. Hotel was nicely situated we used Lancaster Gate underground could also use Queensgate. Our show was at Prince Edward Theatre(Old Compton Rd.). Just to say we could hear the underground trains - but this was not a problem for us-it was quite nice actually, but if you are noise sensitive then...... Breakfast in the dining rm was very good selection and very helpful pleasant staff who kept everything tidy, topped up+all fresh. Overall we were delighted after having read some of the reviews submitted so far before we went and after having booked lastmin. Agreed it is not 4* but maybe because of the swimming pool it gets this rating. We did have a good package deal on lastmin. So if you were booking at normal rates you may consder this point. We would not have been happy to pay for it as a 4* normal rates.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous - avoid at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: PeteIoM
Reviews.Content: Wish I'd read the reviews here before I booked. Worst 4-star hotel I have ever stayed at (how can it even be classed as a 4-star???) Rooms are acceptably clean but so tired and shabby there are stains on carpets. No air conditioning. Tiny 14" TVs. Have to wrestle with bath curtain when taking a shower. Water temperature difficult to control. Bed mattress hard. Worst of all are the breakfasts. Never seen anything like them. Very little fruit choice. For tea you have to fill a cup with water and add your own tea bag. Coffee from a machine. Buffet breakfast consisted of mushrooms and rice - I kid you not!! They gave me a proper cooked breakfast when I made a fuss but it was very average. I rarely write reviews but people need to be warned about this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: guyfawkes27
Reviews.Content: I have never thought about writing a review but this hotel is so bad I had to warn others. The rooms are tiny and in poor condition. We had mould all over the walls in ours. The carpet in our room was disgustingly dirty. We ordered a taxi through reception and it cost us £25 to get to Oxford street. We hailed one on the way back and it cost us £10! It was pretty clear that the receptionist just called his mate and rips people off. The same member of staff also promised that our twin beds would be pushded together and made into a double but this never happened.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Awful”
Reviews.Author: littlecicken
Reviews.Content: Completely amazed that this is classed as a 4 star hotel, i have stayed in better 2 stars ones. Our room was completely tiny, unbearably hot with no working air-con, a small fan wa sprovided, the view was the roof and an air conditioning unit. A small 14"CRT with channels one to Four was your rooms entertainment. (Only 2 channels worked) you were given one small pillow and our sheets were very atined!! The staff were all very unhelpful and completely unable; to grasp basic English, Too many staff seated you for breakfast so whil you were collecting your food someone else had been seated at your tabel by the time you arrived back. The food was Awful, i have no idea why a full english breakfast on the first day contained, rubber eggs, bacon and mixed vegetables, only to become worse on the second morning by only being runner beans!!! (obviously last nights left overs) The only positive we found was the swimming pool which i have to say was clean although a little cold for a heated pool. I would never return and would encourage others to seek accomodation elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not to the standard we would expect from a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: dee977
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is good, close to tube stations and just 5 minutes walk from restaurants, shops and Kensington Gardens. However.....we were so very disappointed with the size of our room (number 002) and it was quite shabby, in desperate need of some redecoration and a new carpet (it was so small that if one of us wanted to walk around the room the other had to sit down on the bed because there was no room to pass). Breakfast was 'very average' but the wonderful Spanish staff did their very best to make you feel welcome. The Public areas are nice but the bar closes at 11pm so don't think you can go back to the hotel for a drink after after a day's sightseeing. Fabulous friendly staff but wouldn't stay here again........overpriced and over-rated.

Reviews.Title: “Sum it up in one word .... CRAP”
Reviews.Author: Mattsmum
Reviews.Content: Have used this hotel for many years as a business base. Will not be going back again. Standards have deteriorated severely.

Reviews.Title: “unhospitable”
Reviews.Author: janpowell
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel on saturday,I found the staff quite rude and indifferent,the hotel was ok,quite a walk from tube,around £4 in a cab.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel in the World - Bar none”
Reviews.Author: Philloxt
Reviews.Content: Shameful utter shameful. My wife begged me to take her to this hotel as she had always wanted to stay there. What a mistake! Poor service from the receptionists (with a queue a people standing waiting a girl appeared and decided it was more important to answer the phone first). Our room key didn't work and I was forced to return to reception THREE times before they agreed to send someone up to have a look at the problem. Only one lift worked and when it finally arrived the cleaning woman next to me quickly pushed herself and her trolley into it leaving no room for me! Breakfast was shocking (rubber egg & bacon - the website promised 'traditional English Breakfast') Staff unpleasant and rude - My wife complained that her cup was dirty and was told it was her own fault for putting it near a leaking coffee machine. Our room was like a matchbox and hot. It laughably contained an air -con unit with a sticker on it saying not ready for use yet!! Most staff were Spanish and incapable of understanding basic English (I'm a qualified English teacher so I'm used to communicating using simple English but even this was beyond most of them). We saw dozens of other people complaining during our stay. The manager (I presume he was this) told one unhappy guest that he was "tired of this" and then walked away. A French couple there at the same time were complaining that they had been forced to spend two nights in a single room!
